intro: Secamone macrophylla var. fulva, commonly known as the yellow secamone, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its large, glossy, dark green leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom throughout the year. Its ornamental value is due to its attractive foliage and persistent flowers. It is often cultivated in warm climates for its aesthetic appeal and ability to thrive in shaded environments.
